H0.text: Friction is the force that draws two interacting galaxies toward each other.

H1.text: Gravity is the force that draws two interacting galaxies toward each other.

H2.text: Electricity is the force that draws the two interacting galaxies toward each other.

H3.text: Magnetism is the force that draws two interacting galaxies toward each other.

A4.text: The gravitational attraction between clouds of primordial hydrogen and clumps of dark matter in the early universe caused the hydrogen gas to coalesce, eventually condensing and fusing to form stars.

A5.text: At the cosmological scale, gravity is a dominant player.
